title: ‘Silent mental health crisis’ leaves the middle classes struggling to manage their money
text:
An unseen battle is taking place across Britain as a growing number of the middle classes struggle to manage their finances and mental health.

While people on the breadline face a daily battle with debt, those on middle incomes must contend with a different set of financial pressures that can cause or exacerbate mental health problems. Yet they are reluctant to discuss their money difficulties for fear that they will be stigmatised.

In theory, increased earnings should mean fewer money worries. However, according to research for Telegraph Money by SmartTMS, a healthcare provider, 15pc of middle class people said higher salaries had increased the pressure on their mental health.
